data.title: Mad Max star Tom Hardy is in director Guy Ritchie’s sights for role in live-action Aladdin remake
data.meta_description: GUY RITCHIE’s recent movies haven’t exactly set the box office alight.But he’s now hoping TOM HARDY might stop the rot. I can reveal the directo
data.text:
GUY RITCHIE’s recent movies haven’t exactly set the box office alight.

But he’s now hoping TOM HARDY might stop the rot. I can reveal the director has approached the Brit actor to appear in the live-action remake of Aladdin.

He wants Tom to play the evil Jafar – I’ve had it mocked up for you and, given Tom’s box-office appeal, it’s a sure-fire way to entice parents to take their kids to the cinema.

A source said: “Guy is a huge fan of Tom’s work and securing him would be a major coup.

“There have been conversations and, although nothing is set in stone and things are subject to change, he’s certainly one of Guy’s favoured choices.

“It just depends on schedules whether he’ll be able to sign up.”

Aladdin is the latest Disney animation to be given a live remake, following The Jungle Book, Cinderella – starring LILY JAMES – and Beauty And The Beast.

Beauty grossed £940million, compared to the £100m made by Guy’s recent movie King Arthur: Legend Of The Sword.

Tom revealed the sad news yesterday that beloved pet dog Woody has passed away.

The six-year-old labrador had his time in the sun, accompanying Tom to the 2015 premiere of Kray twins film Legend.

In a message on his Tumblr page, Tom wrote: “He was an Angel. And he was my best friend. We went through so much together.” A touching tribute.

Lily's big fear

LILY JAMES had the role of a lifetime in Cinderella but didn’t always think she’d get her fairytale ending.

The actress, pictured here on her way to London members’ club LouLou’s on Thursday, admitted she is still terrified of auditions after suffering early rejections.

She said: “I always have to wear high-neck tops when I audition because I get this bright red rash. I just get so nervous.

“And I do it and I feel slightly dirty after, like, ‘Oh I just had to give that,’ and then they’re, like, ‘OK, bye’. You walk out and you feel cheated.”

Lily doesn’t face quite the same challenges now – and will star in Winston Churchill biopic Darkest Hour later this year.

That should stop her rash for a while.

'My Firth love is singing'

WITH Oscar-winner COLIN FIRTH as his dad and film producer Livia Giuggioli as his mum, schoolboy Luca Firth could have been a cert for movie stardom.

But he is instead snubbing his screen genes in favour of launching a different career in entertainment.

Singer Luca will tomorrow perform his biggest gig yet, at the Isle of Wight Festival.

He will be on the Hard Rock stage, which features upcoming stars, and his famous dad will be sat watching at the side.

A source said: “Luca’s only 16 but he thinks the Isle of Wight festival will be the perfect platform to launch his career and showcase his own music.

“Colin is every inch the supportive dad and arrived on the island yesterday to support Luca with other family and friends.”

If Luca’s singing is as good as his dad’s acting, he’ll be a huge hit.

The Love Actually star should stick around for a couple more days to see the festival’s headliners.

ARCADE FIRE are the big attraction tonight but ROD STEWART is sure to end the weekend in style when he takes the stage tomorrow.

Sure Rod is right up Colin’s street.

James goes Roman

ROMAN KEMP only got his Capital FM breakfast show gig a month ago but he’s already been winning praise in high places.

In an exclusive interview, he revealed: “The first week I had a message from (TV producer) Ben Winston and the second week I had one from JAMES CORDEN.

“And it was like ‘Let’s work together’.

“I’m working on a couple of projects with those guys.”

Wembley beckons today for the DJ, who will host Capital’s flagship Summertime Ball in front of 90,000 music fans.

He said: “If I fall on the stage it could be hilarious.”

Capital’s blooper reel always needs content.

Vorderman is unlikely groupie

CAROL VORDERMAN makes an unlikely groupie for gritty hardcore group RUM COMMITTEE.
